H0.text: Unicellular organisms are the type of organisms in which daughter cells are individuals.

H1.text: Multicellular organisms are the type of organisms in which daughter cells are individuals.

H2.text: Macroscopic organisms are those in which daughter cells are individuals.

H3.text: Hematopoietic organisms are the type of organisms in which daughter cells are individuals.

A4.text: Prokaryotes... reproduce asexually through a process called binary fission.

A5.text: Yeasts reproduce through mitosis, and many use a process called budding, where most of the cytoplasm is held by the mother cell.
